channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: New books coming in December tell tales of the sea, colonialism and midlife
item.description: As the year wraps up, we bring you some final notable titles — including The Sea Captain's Wife and The Rest of Our Lives — publishing before 2025 comes to a close.
item.content:encoded: As the year wraps up, we bring you some final notable titles — including The Sea Captain's Wife and The Rest of Our Lives — publishing before 2025 comes to a close.
item.dc:creator: Colin Dwyer

item.title: Can the lessons of 1929 help us avert another economic crisis?
item.description: New York Times financial columnist Andrew Ross Sorkin draws parallels between the stock market crash of 1929, which led to the Great Depression, and today's economic uncertainty.
item.content:encoded: New York Times financial columnist Andrew Ross Sorkin draws parallels between the stock market crash of 1929, which led to the Great Depression, and today's economic uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: Dave Davies

item.title: Author Sophie Kinsella, who penned the 'Shopaholic' books, has died at 55
item.description: The author, whose real name was Madeleine Sophie Wickham, was diagnosed with an aggressive form of brain cancer in late 2022.
item.content:encoded:
The author, whose real name was Madeleine Sophie Wickham, was diagnosed with an aggressive form of brain cancer in late 2022.

(Image credit: Anthony Harvey)
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Useful tips from NPR's most popular self-help stories of the year
item.description: A roundup of good advice from Life Kit's 10 most read stories of 2025. Find out which foods support better sleep, how to be happier and how to graciously accept compliments.
item.content:encoded: A roundup of good advice from Life Kit's 10 most read stories of 2025. Find out which foods support better sleep, how to be happier and how to graciously accept compliments.
item.dc:creator: Malaka Gharib

item.title: Brett Cooper says she makes up her own mind — about Trump and everything else
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks conservative commentator Brett Cooper about her YouTube following, her recent criticisms of President Trump and her opinion of Nick Fuentes.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks conservative commentator Brett Cooper about her YouTube following, her recent criticisms of President Trump and her opinion of Nick Fuentes.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: The journey of chop suey, from Ming Dynasty to a once-fashionable Americanized dish
item.description: Before its fall from grace, chop suey was a holiday tradition for families who don't celebrate Christmas, even being immortalized in songs and film.
item.content:encoded: Before its fall from grace, chop suey was a holiday tradition for families who don't celebrate Christmas, even being immortalized in songs and film.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: 'Pluribus' star Rhea Seehorn says no thanks to a world dictated by group think
item.description: In the Apple TV series, Seehorn stars as a woman named Carol who suddenly finds herself surrounded by people who are inexplicably happy. The only problem: Carol's not interested in joining them.
item.content:encoded: In the Apple TV series, Seehorn stars as a woman named Carol who suddenly finds herself surrounded by people who are inexplicably happy. The only problem: Carol's not interested in joining them.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Believe it or not, this book makes taxes fascinating
item.description: The Price of Democracy tells the history of taxation from colonization to the present day. It's essential reading for anyone who cares about preserving democracy.
item.content:encoded: The Price of Democracy tells the history of taxation from colonization to the present day. It's essential reading for anyone who cares about preserving democracy.
item.dc:creator: Ericka Taylor

item.title: Jazz, joy and one ragged Christmas tree: 60 years of 'A Charlie Brown Christmas'
item.description: On Dec. 9, 1965, "A Charlie Brown Christmas" premiered on television. In 1995, Peanuts creator Charles Schulz spoke with NPR's Bob Edwards on Morning Edition.
item.content:encoded: On Dec. 9, 1965, "A Charlie Brown Christmas" premiered on television. In 1995, Peanuts creator Charles Schulz spoke with NPR's Bob Edwards on Morning Edition.
item.dc:creator: Bob Edwards

item.title: How a member of HR helped a woman diagnosed with breast cancer
item.description: When Gillian Kline was diagnosed with breast cancer, she had one day to figure out a health insurance plan at her workplace. She didn't know what to do — until HR team member Alex Mackey got involved.
item.content:encoded: When Gillian Kline was diagnosed with breast cancer, she had one day to figure out a health insurance plan at her workplace. She didn't know what to do — until HR team member Alex Mackey got involved.
